Diprotes Buruh Iurannya Naik, BPJS Kesehatan Buka Suara
01 Nov 2019, 06:25 by Trio Hamdani


Foto: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Buruh protes dengan kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan. Hal itu karena upah buruh cuma naik 8,51% di tahun depan sementara iuran BPJS Kesehatan naik 100%.Direktur Utama BPJS Kesehatan Fachmi ldris menjelaskan bahwa buruh yang mungkin merasakan dampak kenaikan iuran adalah yang gajinya Rp 8 juta ke atas. Kelompok tersebut dia bilang jumlahnya tak lebih dari 5%.Hal itu berdasarkan Peraturan Presiden (Perpres) Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan atas Perpres Nomor 82 Tahun 2018 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan yang diteken Jokowi pada 24 Oktober 2019.Di situ diterangkan bahwa pemerintah menaikkan maksimal batas upah untuk dasar perhitungan iuran bagi peserta penerima iuran badan usaha dari Rp 8 juta menjadi Rp 12 juta. Persentase iuran tetap sebesar 5%, terdiri dari 4% pemberi upah dan 1% pekerja."Kami sampaikan saja dalam master file kami dari total pekerja penerima upah yang penghasilannya Rp 8 juta ke atas tidak sampai 5% (jumlahnya)," kata dia di Kantor Pusat BPJS Kesehatan, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Sementara 95% sisanya tidak terpengaruh dengan kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan."95% peserta penerima upah tidak terpengaruh dengan naiknya atau rasionalisasi iuran. Saya tidak ingin buruh jadi bingung terbawa berita bahwa terbitnya perpres berpengaruh terhadap daya beli. Karena tidak ada pengeluaran tambahan dari pekerja penerima upah," jelasnya.Bahkan, untuk penerima upah yang terdampak menurutnya tidak signifikan, yaitu Rp 27 ribu yang mencakup 5 orang. Bila angka tersebut dibagi 5 tidak lebih dari Rp 6.000, tepatnya Rp 5.400."Tambahannya Rp 27.000 untuk 5 orang. Jadi sekitar Rp 5-6 ribu untuk pekerja yang penghasilannya Rp 8 juta ke atas," tambahnya.Sebagai informasi, ribuan buruh menggelar aksi unjuk rasa di kantor Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan (Kemnaker), kemarin, Kamis (31/10/2019).Menurut Presiden KSPI Said Iqbal, hal itu tidak masuk akal. Di saat pemerintah hanya menaikkan UMP 8,51%, iuran BPJS malah naik mencapai 100%."Upah naiknya cuma 8%, BPJS naiknya 100%. Itu nggak masuk akal. Ekonomi kita nggak masuk akal," tegas Iqbal.

Protest from Worker Contributions Goes Up, Health BPJS Opens Voice
Nov 01 2019, 06:25 by Trio Hamdani


Photo: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Workers protest with rising BPJS Health contributions. That is because workers' wages only rose 8.51% in the next year while BPJS Health contributions rose 100%. Chief Director of BPJS Health Fachmi Irris explained that workers who might feel the impact of the increase in contributions were those whose salaries were Rp8 million and above. He said the group numbered no more than 5%. It was based on Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 75 of 2019 concerning Amendments to Perpres Number 82 of 2018 on Health Insurance signed by Jokowi on October 24, 2019. There it was explained that the government increased the maximum limit wages for basic calculation of contributions for participants receiving business entity contributions from Rp. 8 million to Rp. 12 million. Percentage of fixed contributions of 5%, consisting of 4% of wage earners and 1% of workers. "We just say in our master file of total wage earning workers whose income is above Rp 8 million and less than 5% (the amount)," he said in BPJS Health Head Office, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). While the remaining 95% are not affected by the increase in BPJS Health contributions. "95% of wage earners are not affected by the increase or rationalization of contributions. I don't want workers to be confused by the news that the issuance of Perpres has an effect on purchasing power because there is no additional expenditure from workers who receive wages, "he explained. In fact, according to the recipient of wages affected, according to him is not significant, namely Rp. 27 thousand which includes 5 people. If the figure is divided into 5, no more than Rp. 6,000, to be precise Rp. 5,400. "An additional Rp. 27,000 for 5 people. So around Rp. 5-6 thousand for workers whose income is Rp. 8 million and above," he added. a rally at the Ministry of Manpower's office yesterday, Thursday (10/31/2019). According to KSPI President Said Iqbal, that didn't make sense. When the government only increased the UMP 8.51%, the BPJS fees actually went up to 100%. "The increase in wages was only 8%, BPJS rose 100%. That doesn't make sense. Our economy doesn't make sense," Iqbal stressed.
